title: Recurring (network/shared) calendar events with notification sound keep re-pinging every minute
content:
This has been a problem for me for years, across multiple machines and OSes (all flavors of Linux), and many versions of Thunderbird. I've looked for solutions online, and I've never even seen anyone else describe the same problem.

I create recurring reminders ("Remember to do 'X' every day at 6:30") with a custom-selected notification sound (a little bell), and when the reminder comes due, the notification sound keeps re-playing every minute ... I mean, literally, exactly, every 60 seconds.

It only seems to happen with shared/subscribed online calendars (I use Nextcloud for my shared calendars).

This is not a snooze setting issue. My snooze is set to the default value of 10 minutes, plus this happens immediately after the reminder first pops up, even without "snoozing" it.

I am currently running Thunderbird 115.3.1 on Linux Mint Debian (LMDE 6), but again, this dates back to Thunderbird 80-something, maybe even earlier, and has persisted on Linux Mint (Standard), Ubuntu, PopOS, probably others I'm forgetting (all Debian flavors).

My best guess is Thunderbird is doing a minute-ly refresh from the Nextcloud CalDAV server, and somehow, it is interpreting each refresh as "play it again, Sam".

Any tips or suggestions are appreciated. Thanks in advance. -s

Edit to add: I just noticed, when I have multiple reminders in the Reminders pop-up, when I update one of them (snooze or dismiss), the other(s) immediately re-play the notification sound -- again, it feels like my local change is triggering an update to/from the CalDAV server, which is then triggering Thunderbird to re-play the notification sound.
